definition: to dislike/suspicion/resentment/enmity/abbr. for 嫌犯[xian2 fan4], criminal suspect
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: Gentlemen, my father always detested me because I could not understand mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 先生們，我的父親從來就嫌棄我，因爲我不懂數學。

sentences.english: The south temple loves Wen one face to abandon.
Am I cleaner than you by what do you cold-shoulder me?
sentences.chinese: 我比你乾淨你憑什麼嫌棄我？。

sentences.english: People use discrimination, abandon to see them, even isolated them.
sentences.chinese: 人們用歧視，嫌棄的目光去看待他們，甚至孤立他們。
我老爸嫌棄我，現在泰勒也丟下了我。

sentences.english: GuanYa lili is a should be under, but also asked whether Luan school abandon themselves.
sentences.chinese: 關雅麗卻一口應下，還問欒學堂是否嫌棄自己。

sentences.english: Tian Juhua think iron tiger abandon her, in a pet tiger boom to the iron door.
sentences.chinese: 田菊華以爲鐵虎嫌棄她，一氣之下把鐵虎轟出門去。

sentences.english: And I don't stay where I'm not wanted.
sentences.chinese: 再說，別人嫌棄我，我也不會死皮賴臉地住在這兒。

sentences.english: My father 's face as she was not good, always think of her.
sentences.chinese: 父親的臉色因爲她就沒有好看過，老是嫌棄她。

sentences.english: When you saw evil people, you distained them.
sentences.chinese: 當你看到罪惡的人時，你厭惡嫌棄他們。

sentences.english: I cold-shoulder you to explain I am cleaner than you.
sentences.chinese: 我嫌棄你說明我比你乾淨。

sentences.english: Mister never abandon me, always glad to.
sentences.chinese: 老總從未嫌棄過我，總是欣然前往。

definition: to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
